1.question: What information should you NEVER share online with strangers?
1.description: Think about what information could help someone find you or pretend to be you.

a.explanation: Your favorite color is safe to share! It can't be used to find you or hurt you.

b.text: Your full name, address, and phone number
b.explanation: Excellent! This personal information should only be shared with trusted adults like parents and teachers.

c.text: What games you like to play
c.explanation: Talking about games you enjoy is usually safe and can help you make friends with similar interests.

warningDemo.title: Danger: Sharing Personal Information
warningDemo.description: When you share your real name, address, or phone number online, strangers can use this information to find you in real life.
warningDemo.consequence: Someone could show up at your house, call your family, or even steal your identity!

2.question: You want to create a password for your new game account. Which password is the strongest?
2.description: A strong password protects your account from hackers who try to guess it.

a.explanation: This is too easy to guess! Hackers try common passwords like this first.

b.explanation: Perfect! This password is long, has different types of characters, and is hard to guess but easy for you to remember.

c.explanation: This is one of the most common passwords ever! It would take a hacker less than a second to guess.

warningDemo.title: Weak Password Danger
warningDemo.description: Weak passwords can be guessed by hackers in seconds using special computer programs.
warningDemo.consequence: Someone could steal your account, delete your progress, or use your account to bully others!

3.question: A website asks for your parent's credit card information to get 'free' games. What should you do?
3.description: Sometimes websites that seem free actually want to trick you into spending money.

a.text: Ask your parents first before entering any payment information
a.explanation: Smart choice! Always ask a trusted adult before giving any payment information, even for 'free' things.

b.text: Enter the information quickly to get the free games
b.explanation: This could be very dangerous! The website might charge money or steal the credit card information.

c.text: Make up fake credit card numbers
c.explanation: Making up information is dishonest, and many websites can detect fake numbers anyway.

warningDemo.title: Credit Card Scam Alert
warningDemo.description: Many 'free' websites are actually scams that will charge your parents' credit card or steal the information.
warningDemo.consequence: Your family could lose money, or criminals could use the stolen card information to buy things!

4.question: You receive a message from someone claiming to be your friend, but something seems different about how they're writing. What should you do?
4.description: Sometimes hackers take over accounts and pretend to be people you know.

a.text: Ask them a question only your real friend would know
a.explanation: Great thinking! This is a smart way to verify if it's really your friend or someone pretending to be them.

b.text: Immediately send them personal information they're asking for
b.explanation: This could be dangerous! Even if it looks like your friend, you should verify it's really them first.

c.explanation: While being cautious is good, it might actually be your friend who needs help. It's better to verify first.

warningDemo.title: Account Takeover Warning
warningDemo.description: Hackers sometimes steal accounts and pretend to be your friends to trick you into sharing information.
warningDemo.consequence: You might give personal information to a stranger, or they could trick you into downloading harmful software!

5.question: You see a pop-up that says 'You've won $1000! Click here to claim your prize!' What should you do?
5.description: Pop-ups like this are often tricks to get you to click on dangerous links.

a.text: Click immediately to get the money
a.explanation: This is definitely a scam! Real prizes don't work this way, and clicking could download harmful software.

b.text: Close the pop-up without clicking and tell an adult
b.explanation: Perfect! This is exactly what you should do. These pop-ups are always fake and designed to trick you.

c.text: Share the link with your friends so they can win too
c.explanation: This would spread the dangerous link to your friends! Never share suspicious pop-ups or links.

warningDemo.title: Fake Prize Scam
warningDemo.description: These pop-ups are designed to trick you into clicking malicious links or downloading harmful software.
warningDemo.consequence: Your computer could get infected with viruses, or scammers could steal your family's information!

6.question: Which of these is the safest way to download a new game?
6.description: Not all websites are safe for downloading games and apps.

a.text: Download from a random website that offers it for free
a.explanation: This is very risky! Unknown websites often have fake games with viruses hidden inside.

b.text: Use official app stores like Google Play or Apple App Store
b.explanation: Excellent choice! Official app stores check games for safety before allowing downloads.

c.text: Click on a link someone sent you in a message
c.explanation: This could be dangerous! Even friends can accidentally share harmful links without knowing it.

warningDemo.title: Malicious Download Warning
warningDemo.description: Downloading games from unsafe websites can install viruses or malware on your device.
warningDemo.consequence: Your device could be damaged, your personal files stolen, or your accounts hacked!

7.question: Someone online offers to meet you in person after chatting for a few days. What's the safest response?
7.description: Meeting strangers from the internet can be very dangerous, even if they seem nice online.

a.text: Agree to meet them at a public place like a park
a.explanation: This is still very dangerous! People online can lie about who they are, and even public places aren't safe for meeting strangers.

b.text: Never agree to meet and tell a trusted adult immediately
b.explanation: This is the safest choice! Adults who care about you can help protect you from dangerous situations.

c.text: Ask them to video chat first to make sure they're real
c.explanation: Even video chatting doesn't make meeting safe. People can still be dangerous even if they look friendly on camera.

warningDemo.title: Stranger Danger Online
warningDemo.description: People online can pretend to be someone they're not. They might be adults pretending to be kids.
warningDemo.consequence: Meeting strangers from the internet could put you in serious physical danger!

8.question: You want to post a photo of your new school uniform. What should you be careful about?
8.description: Photos can reveal more information than you think, even when you're trying to be careful.

a.text: Make sure the school name and logo aren't visible in the photo
a.explanation: Smart thinking! School names and logos can help strangers figure out where you go to school and find you.

b.text: Post it immediately - it's just a uniform
b.explanation: School uniforms can reveal which school you attend, making it easier for strangers to find you.

c.text: Include your full name in the caption so friends know it's you
c.explanation: Adding your full name makes it even easier for strangers to identify and locate you!

warningDemo.title: Location Information Risk
warningDemo.description: Photos with school information can help strangers figure out where you spend your time every day.
warningDemo.consequence: Someone could use this information to find you at school or follow you home!

9.question: You receive an email saying your favorite game account will be deleted unless you reply with your password. What should you do?
9.description: Scammers often pretend to be from companies you trust to steal your login information.

a.text: Reply immediately with your password to save your account
a.explanation: This is a phishing scam! Real companies never ask for your password in emails.

b.text: Delete the email and check your account by logging in normally
b.explanation: Perfect! If there was a real problem, you'd see it when you log in normally. This email is definitely fake.

c.text: Forward the email to all your friends to warn them
c.explanation: Don't forward suspicious emails! This could spread the scam to your friends. Just delete it.

warningDemo.title: Phishing Email Scam
warningDemo.description: Scammers send fake emails pretending to be from games, banks, or other services to steal your passwords.
warningDemo.consequence: They could steal your account, spend your game currency, or even access other accounts with the same password!

10.question: Which of these is the best way to keep your online accounts secure?
10.description: There are several ways to make your accounts harder for hackers to break into.

a.text: Use the same strong password for all your accounts
a.explanation: Using the same password everywhere is risky! If one account gets hacked, all your accounts could be in danger.

b.text: Use different strong passwords and enable two-factor authentication
b.explanation: Excellent! Different passwords protect you if one gets stolen, and two-factor authentication adds extra security.

c.text: Write all your passwords on a piece of paper and keep it on your desk
c.explanation: This makes it easy for anyone who sees the paper to access all your accounts! Keep passwords private.

warningDemo.title: Account Security Weakness
warningDemo.description: Poor password practices make it easy for hackers to access multiple accounts once they crack one password.
warningDemo.consequence: Hackers could access your email, social media, games, and even your family's accounts!

11.question: You're playing an online game and another player asks for your home address to send you a gift. How do you respond?
11.description: Even in games, you need to be careful about sharing personal information with other players.

a.text: Give them your address - they seem nice and want to send a gift
a.explanation: Never give your address to online strangers! They could be lying about the gift and have bad intentions.

b.text: Politely decline and suggest staying friends just in the game
b.explanation: Perfect response! You can be friendly in games without sharing personal information that could put you at risk.

c.text: Give them a fake address so they can't find you
c.explanation: It's better to be honest and decline rather than lie. Plus, they might figure out it's fake and get angry.

warningDemo.title: Gaming Stranger Danger
warningDemo.description: People in online games can seem friendly, but you never know who they really are or what they want.
warningDemo.consequence: Giving your address could lead to unwanted visitors, stolen packages, or someone finding out where you live!

12.question: Before sharing a funny photo or video online, what's the most important thing to consider?
12.description: Once something is posted online, it can be very hard to completely remove it.

a.text: Whether it might embarrass you or others in the future
a.explanation: Great thinking! Things you post online can last forever and might affect you or others later in life.

b.text: How many likes and comments it might get
b.explanation: Popularity isn't as important as safety! Focus on whether the content is appropriate and safe to share.

c.text: Whether your friends will think it's funny
c.explanation: Your friends' opinions matter, but the most important thing is whether the content could cause problems later.

warningDemo.title: Digital Footprint Warning
warningDemo.description: Everything you post online creates a permanent digital footprint that can be seen by future employers, schools, and others.
warningDemo.consequence: Embarrassing posts could affect your reputation, college applications, or job opportunities years from now!
